title: Fundamentals of Urban Planning
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in urban planning. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Introduction to Urban Planning
description: In-depth analysis of urban planning principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Applied Urban Planning
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in urban planning. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.

title: Architectural History
description: Rigorous treatment of architectural history theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Design Studio
description: Rigorous treatment of design studio theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Advanced Sustainability
description: In-depth analysis of sustainability principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Building Technology
description: Rigorous treatment of building technology theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Graduate Digital Design
description: In-depth analysis of digital design principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: ARCH 391 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Digital Design
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of digital design. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: ARCH 315 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Architectural History
description: Advanced exploration of architectural history covering current research and industry practices.
prerequisites: ARCH 359 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Architectural History
description: Rigorous treatment of architectural history theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.
prerequisites: ARCH 300 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Design Studio
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of design studio. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: ARCH 300 and senior standing or graduate status
